answers.answer: The main ways to enter Romania are by obtaining temporary protection, with a short-stay right, or as an asylum seeker.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'The main ways to enter Romania'.

answers.answer: A person's rights in Romania depend on their status.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'My rights'.

answers.answer: Temporary protection is a special form of protection for people fleeing the war in Ukraine.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'Temporary protection'.

answers.answer: If you are a beneficiary of temporary protection, your permit is automatically valid until 03/04/2026.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'Temporary protection'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian nationals can enter Romania with a short-stay right by presenting a valid passport at the border crossing.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'Short stay'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian nationals can stay up to 90 days in Romania with a short-stay right.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'Short stay'.

answers.answer: Asylum is a form of protection that allows a foreigner who cannot return to their country of origin to remain in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'Applying for asylum'.

answers.answer: One can apply for asylum within Romania at a later point, either in writing or verbally.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'Applying for asylum'.

answers.answer: If someone cannot present any documents upon entering Romania, they will need to apply for asylum at the border.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: For support in Poland, one can call the hotline at +48 47 721 75 75 or visit www.ua.gov.pl and https://pomagamukrainie.gov.pl/.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'For support in other European countries'.

answers.answer: For support in Moldova, one can call the hotline at 0 8000 15 27 or visit https://igm.gov.md/en/temporary-protection/.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'For support in other European countries'.

answers.answer: For support in Hungary, one can call the hotline at +36 1 463 9292 or visit http://www.bmbah.hu/index.php?option=com_k2&view=item&id=1736:2022-03-04-12-25-49&lang=hu.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'For support in other European countries'.

answers.answer: In the Slovak Republic, support is available via the Slovak Interior Ministry hotlines for Ukrainian-speakers at +421 513 816 111 and +421 259 765 111, and through the website https://www.mic.iom.sk/sk/novinky/760-informatsiya-ukrayina.html.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'For support in other European countries'.
